channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: There is a simple fix for America’s job-quality crisis: actually give workers a piece of the business
item.description: My dad spent 40 years operating heavy machinery. He was proud of his work but he didn’t feel respected. Today, I see those same tensions are still wit...

item.title: Maybe Spotify knows more about you than you do
item.description: Spotify has a knack for mining your listening data into something fun and shareable rather than weird and creepy for its annual “Wrapped” feature. Thi...

item.title: When David Ellison was 13, his billionaire father Larry bought him a plane. He competed in air shows before leaving it to become a Hollywood executive
item.description: Ellison, 42, revived “Top Gun”—and now he’s taking the fight to Netflix.

item.title: Architects are embracing this ancient building technique to combat climate change—and soulless design
item.description: In the English countryside, a new project has emerged from the landscape—quite literally. Rammed Earth House, a residential estate by London-based Tuc...

item.title: Why this once-trendy DTC sneaker pioneer is pivoting to women’s vitamins
item.description: After Joey Zwillinger stepped down as CEO of Allbirds in March 2024, he took three months off—mainly because his wife Liz said she’d divorce him if he...

item.title: Why ‘Indecisive’ People Tend to Make Better Decisions, Backed by Cognitive Science
item.description: Trait ambivalence sounds like a bad thing, but not when it causes you to seek more information and see both sides of an issue.

item.title: Walmart stock is making a historic change today. Here’s why WMT is moving from the NYSE to the Nasdaq
item.description: It’s a historic day for both Walmart and the Nasdaq. Today, America’s largest brick-and-mortar retailer begins trading on the Nasdaq after its shares ...

item.title: The low-hire, low-fire economy crawls along with job openings unchanged from September to October
item.description: Job openings have come down steadily since peaking at a record 12.1 million in March 2022. They were 7.7 million for both of the last two months.

item.title: Chase’s Newest Sapphire Lounge, Complete With Champagne Service, Makes a Case for Its $795 Price Tag
item.description: Locked in a rewards arms race with Citi, Amex, and Capital One, the finance giant leans into lavishness for its new lounge at the Harry Reid Airport.

item.title: How to Fire a Jerk
item.description: … and two other tricky workplace dilemmas.

item.title: WNBA star Paige Bueckers launches good-for-you snack Ragerz with Chris Paul’s brand Good Eat’n
item.description: If you’re searching for a new snack that’s heavy on flavor but manages to skip the unhealthy additives, you’re in luck. There’s a new one called Rager...

item.title: Iconic Brewery Makes Deep Workforce Cuts, Report Says
item.description: It’s facing declining sales while operating under recent C-suite shifts.

item.title: Sign Up Now: Bogg Bag CEO Kim Vaccarella and Glowbar CEO Rachel Liverman in This Exclusive Inc. Livestream Today at 12 p.m. ET

item.title: Deutsche Bank and Jeffrey Epstein’s ghost
item.description: Given its long history of servicing high-risk clients, it is perhaps unsurprising that Deutsche Bank stepped in when Epstein was ditched by JPMorgan.
